Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2011 07:18PM pattyeberry wrote: My sister has breast cancer with multiple liver mets. On April 11, 2011 she will receive a treatment called TACE. This is truly worth looking into for those of you that are not a candidate for liver surgery. TACE procedure is when they place chemo beads directly into the liver which kills off the blood supply to the liver tumors creating ghost lesions. Her oncologist suggested this chemo treatment since her previous systemic chemo was giving her many side effects and she needed a chemo break. So, please google "chemo beads" and ask your oncologist about this treatment for liver mets. HOPE LIVES!
Posts.Title: Surgery to remove liver mets? lilylady cati13
